body_content.explanation: a second, third, etc. graft (= an occasion when a piece of healthy skin or bone is cut from one part of a person's body and used to repair another damaged part, or when a piece is cut from one living plant and attached to another plant so that it grows there):
examples: Two regrafts were necessary as the primary grafts did not heal.
No difference in the overall yield appeared to exist between new grafts and re-grafts.

body_content.explanation: to take and put in place a second, third, etc. piece of healthy skin or bone cut from one part of a person's body and use it to repair another damaged part, or to take a second, third, etc. piece cut from one living plant and attach it to another plant so that it grows there:
examples: The cornea may need to be regrafted.
The subtree is then pruned again and re-grafted in another position.
